abstract: In effort to pare its ties to the state, Citigroup has been working on a plan to reduce the U.S. government’s 34 percent stake in the bank, including a $5 billion stock offering, The Wall Street Journal said.
snippet: In effort to pare its ties to the state, Citigroup has been working on a plan to reduce the U.S. government’s 34 percent stake in the bank, including a $5 billion stock offering, The Wall Street Journal said.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup, the troubled banking giant, has reportedly been working on a plan to reduce the government’s nearly 34 percent stake in the company.

headline.main: Citi Said to Consider Plan to Trim U.S. Stake
